content:
I need a LinearOrderedCancelAddCommMonoid such that every nonempty finite subset has an infimum (or, in terms that ConditionallyCompleteLattice uses, I need every nonempty subset which is bounded below to have an infimum).

I see that ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderedField gives me everything I need but is a total overkill.
What can I use instead?
Again, my main point is that I only need LinearOrderedCancelAddCommMonoid and infima.
I don't need multiplication.
I don't need inverses.
I don't need suprema.

Please, suggest anything reasonable, even if it doesn't exist in Mathlib, even if Mathlib wouldn't want to include such a class.
A linear ordered set already has infima and suprema
Oh, you are right! I didn't find it because LinearOrder calls it Min and Max instead.
Is there something like Finset.univ.inf' but for Min instead?
Oh there is Finset.min' and I seem to be blind.
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
I am now wondering why LinearOrderedField isn't automatically ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderedField but I don't really need it, just wondering...

Martin Dvořák said:

not wondering, just wondering...

I am now going for a facepalm hattrick...

The reason why @Mario Carneiro is right is that I required nonempty finite subset.
The reason why @Yury G. Kudryashov is right is that ConditionallyCompleteLattice requires nonempty bounded subset.
I wasn't really sure what you meant when you dropped the "finite" in your first sentence
there is a big difference between nonempty finite subsets and nonempty subsets!
I was my blatant mistake assuming that "nonempty finite subset" and "nonempty bounded subset" are the same thing.
they are the same if the type is docs#LocallyFiniteOrder
But not Rat which is a linearly ordered field but not conditionally complete.
